item.title: Build changes
item.description:
The XZ Utils code should be C99/C11 compliant. I'm not interested in changing the code to C89. If you use GCC, version 3.3 or later should work fine (it at least used to work a long ago, 3.3 is so old now). Normally configure sets up the required compiler flags like -std=gnu99 or -std=c99 to enable C99 support with older GCC.

The range_common.h problem was fixed in February and already included in xz 5.2.4.

Thanks.

item.title: Build changes
item.description:
I had to make some modifications that might be useful for others:

Two places in the code, lzma_mt_block_size and encoder_find, use initial declarations in the for loop which are only C99 and I believe GCC complains about.

In range_common.h, it may be necessary to remove HAVE_CONFIG_H and simply #include "common.h" without the ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H. I believe common.h already does this check. Having HAVE_CONFIG_H prevents it from including stdint.h by inclusion of common.h if not using a config.

Thanks,
Nathan
